entry.title: the airline's fleet (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when expanding the airline's fleet in 1989, the directors of Turkish Airlines did not fulfil the request of Turkey's president to buy the Boeing 747, and ordered the Airbus A340 (example pictured) instead?

entry.title: Uhlia allenbyensis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the fossil palm Uhlia allenbyensis has been found with "tar spots"?

entry.title: Catherine Flanagan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Catherine Flanagan was arrested and jailed in 1917 for picketing the White House in support of women's suffrage?

entry.title: half a square mile (130 ha) in Alberta (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that half a square mile (130 ha) in Alberta contains an estimated 6,000 arthropod species and is one of the most biodiverse areas in the province for its size?

entry.title: Charles Johnson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Charles Johnson received the most votes for student body president at the University of Colorado Boulder, even though he had already been disqualified from running?

entry.title: Sdorica (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Sdorica featured crossovers with the fellow Rayark games Cytus II and Deemo, involving special events in Sdorica and song albums in Cytus II?

entry.title: Bethlehem, Georgia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a new Christmas stamp that debuted in the 350-person town of Bethlehem, Georgia, in 1967 got so much attention that the two-employee post office had to hire 43 temporary workers?

entry.title: Horace Archambeault (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Horace Archambeault introduced a Quebec bill in 1904 that would make employers responsible for workplace accidents, even if they were not negligent?
